name: HTML Complete Guide - Web Development Fundamentals
description: Master HTML5 and learn to structure web pages with semantic markup, forms, multimedia, and accessibility features.

exercises.title: Basic HTML Structure
exercises.description: Create a properly structured HTML5 document with essential elements.
exercises.theory: HTML documents require a specific structure with doctype, html, head, and body elements. The head contains metadata while the body contains visible content.
exercises.objective: Create a valid HTML5 document with title, heading, paragraph, and list.
exercises.initialCode:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <!-- Add title and meta tags -->
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Add content here -->
</body>
</html>
exercises.solutionCode:
Welcome to My Website

This is my first HTML page.

  • HTML
  • CSS
  • JavaScript
requirements: Create a paragraph and unordered list
hints: Use lang attribute in html tag
Include charset and viewport meta tags
Use ul for unordered list, li for list items

exercises.title: Semantic HTML Layout
exercises.description: Build a semantic webpage layout using HTML5 structural elements.
exercises.theory: Semantic HTML uses elements that clearly describe their meaning to both browser and developer. Elements like header, nav, main, article, section, and footer improve accessibility and SEO.
exercises.objective: Create a semantic webpage layout with header, navigation, main content, and footer.
exercises.initialCode:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>Semantic Layout</title>
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Build semantic structure here -->
</body>
</html>
exercises.solutionCode:

requirements: Use header, nav, main, article, section, footer
Add meaningful content in articles and sections
hints: Header typically contains logo and navigation

exercises.title: HTML Forms and Validation
exercises.description: Create interactive forms with input validation and different field types.
exercises.theory: HTML forms collect user input using various input types. HTML5 introduced new input types and attributes for validation like required, pattern, email, number, etc.
exercises.objective: Build a registration form with validation for different input types.
exercises.initialCode:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>Registration Form</title>
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Create registration form here -->
</body>
</html>
exercises.solutionCode: User Registration
requirements: Create form with various input types
Include text, email, password, number inputs
hints: min and max work with number inputs

exercises.title: Multimedia and Embedding
exercises.description: Learn to embed images, audio, video, and iframes in web pages.
exercises.theory: HTML provides elements for embedding multimedia content. img for images, audio for sound, video for videos, and iframe for embedding external content. Always include alt text for accessibility.
exercises.objective: Create a multimedia page with images, audio, video, and embedded content.
exercises.initialCode:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>Multimedia Page</title>
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Add multimedia elements here -->
</body>
</html>

requirements: Embed images with proper alt text

hints: Always include alt attribute for images
Use controls attribute for media playback
Provide multiple source formats for compatibility
Set width and height for video and iframe

exercises.title: Advanced HTML Features
exercises.description: Implement advanced HTML features like data attributes, details/summary, and microdata.
exercises.theory: Advanced HTML features include data-* attributes for storing custom data, details/summary for collapsible content, and microdata for structured data markup that helps search engines understand content.
exercises.objective: Create a page using advanced HTML5 features including data attributes and semantic markup.

<html>

</body>
</html>
